meanings.definition: Relating to the scientific description of peoples and cultures.
meanings.sent1: The ethnographic study focused on understanding different cultural practices.
meanings.sent2: She conducted an ethnographic research project to learn about tribal traditions.
meanings.sent3: The ethnographic approach to studying communities revealed fascinating insights.
meanings.sent4: Her ethnographic observations painted a vivid picture of societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The ethnographic analysis provided a detailed view of cultural diversity.

meanings.definition: A study or report based on ethnographic research.
meanings.sent1: The ethnographic presented at the conference highlighted unique cultural aspects.
meanings.sent2: I found an interesting ethnographic about indigenous communities in the library.
meanings.sent3: Reading the ethnographic made me appreciate the richness of different cultures.
meanings.sent4: The ethnographic report shed light on the customs of remote villages.
meanings.sent5: His ethnographic study offered valuable insights into societal traditions.
